rev.diff:
Line 38: Line 38:
SELinux is available with commercial support as part of [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] (RHEL) version 4 and all future releases. The supported policy in RHEL4 is the targeted policy which aims for maximum ease of use and thus is not as restrictive as it might be. Future versions of RHEL will have more targets in the targeted policy which will mean more restrictive policies.
SELinux is available with commercial support as part of [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] (RHEL) version 4 and all future releases. The supported policy in RHEL4 is the targeted policy which aims for maximum ease of use and thus is not as restrictive as it might be. Future versions of RHEL will have more targets in the targeted policy which will mean more restrictive policies.
â
In free community supported Linux distributions, SELinux is supported in [[Debian]] as of the etch release [http://wiki.debian.org/SELinux], [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] as of 8.04 Hardy Heron, [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] since version 2, [[Hardened Gentoo]], and [[Yellow Dog Linux]].
+
In free community supported Linux distributions, SELinux is supported in [[Debian]] as of the etch release [http://wiki.debian.org/SELinux], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]] as of 8.04 Hardy Heron, [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] since version 2, [[Hardened Gentoo]], and [[Yellow Dog Linux]].
It is also supported in [[EnGarde Secure Linux]] [http://www.engardelinux.org] which requires registration to download.
It is also supported in [[EnGarde Secure Linux]] [http://www.engardelinux.org] which requires registration to download.
Line 44: Line 44:
There was some work to provide SELinux packages for [[SUSE]] [http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~bleher/selinux/] and [[Slackware]] [http://blog.diyab.net/se-linux/old-files/], but development seems to have stopped (the files are old).
There was some work to provide SELinux packages for [[SUSE]] [http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~bleher/selinux/] and [[Slackware]] [http://blog.diyab.net/se-linux/old-files/], but development seems to have stopped (the files are old).
â
[[Ubuntu Linux|Ubuntu]] [http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/SELinux] has been supported and it's expected that the first Ubuntu release based on Debian/etch will have better support of SELinux.[http://lwn.net/Articles/273992/]
+
[[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]] [http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/SELinux] has been supported and it's expected that the first Ubuntu release based on Debian/etch will have better support of SELinux.[http://lwn.net/Articles/273992/]
There has been work on other distributions such as [[Familiar Linux|Familiar]], but some of this was ceased due to technical reasons (the Familiar work was abandoned when SELinux needed [[Extended file attributes|extended attributes]] which were not supported in the [[JFFS2]] filesystem).
There has been work on other distributions such as [[Familiar Linux|Familiar]], but some of this was ceased due to technical reasons (the Familiar work was abandoned when SELinux needed [[Extended file attributes|extended attributes]] which were not supported in the [[JFFS2]] filesystem).
